events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker discussing the forward shift of Makar Sankranti due to the Gregorian calendar, explaining the surplus of time in the earth's revolution and its effects on the calendar. The tone is informative and educational. The speaker explains how the surplus time accumulates, leading to errors in the calendar that require correction. A brief discussion of the timing from 2001 to 2008 shifts to the effects to dates in 2009 to 2012. A discussion about shifts by a certain time in the past leads to conclusions and how this time shift results in a pattern will change to a certain date set in the future. He concludes by saying that, Makar Sankranti is celebrated in India with the same gusto and joy, and it is still considered one of the most important festivals of India.
